targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - execution_time)) / 60)::INTEGER AS "Time Since Update"
FROM healthcheck

SELECT 
  CASE
    WHEN server_reachable THEN 'OK'
    ELSE 'Failed'
  END as "Ping Status"
FROM healthcheck

SELECT
  CASE
    WHEN backend_status = 'active' THEN 'OK'
    ELSE backend_status
  END as "Backend Status"  
FROM healthcheck

SELECT 
  CASE
    WHEN postgresql_status = 'active' THEN 'OK'
    ELSE postgresql_status
  END as "DB Status"
FROM healthcheck

SELECT 
  CASE
    WHEN nginx_status = 'active' THEN 'OK'
    ELSE nginx_status
  END as "Nginx Status"
FROM healthcheck

SELECT
  EXTRACT(DAY FROM (ssl_expiry_time - CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)) AS "Days until SSL Expiration"
FROM healthcheck

SELECT
  cpu_usage as "CPU Usage",
  memory_used as "Memory Used",
  memory_available as "Memory Available",
  memory_available::FLOAT / memory_total as "Memory Available, %",
  memory_swap as "Swap Size",
  memory_total as "Memory Total",
  disk_used as "Disk Used",
  disk_total as "Disk Total",
  (disk_total - disk_used)::FLOAT / disk_total as "Disk Available, %"
FROM healthcheck

panels.description: Number of jobs, which weren't successfully finished during last execution

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  SUM(
    CASE 
      WHEN last_execution_status != 'success' THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) as "Number of Failed Jobs"
FROM fetch_jobs_status

panels.title: Failed Jobs

panels.description: Number of jobs, which were last executed more than an hour ago

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  SUM(
    CASE 
      WHEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_execution_time > INTERVAL '1 hour' THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) as "Number of Jobs not Recently Run"
FROM fetch_jobs_status

panels.title: Not Recently Run

panels.description: Number of jobs, which didn't successfully run a full fetch during the last 2 days

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  SUM(
    CASE 
      WHEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_successful_full_fetch_time > INTERVAL '48 hour' THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) as "Number of Jobs without Recent Full Fetch"
FROM fetch_jobs_status

panels.title: No Recent Full Fetch

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - COALESCE(MAX(record_time), TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01')
  )))::INTEGER / 60 AS "Time Since Last Execution"
FROM backup_script_logs 
WHERE event_source = 'main' AND message = 'Finished script execution.'

SELECT
  (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - COALESCE(MAX(record_time), TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01')
  )))::INTEGER / 60 AS "Time Since Database Backup"
FROM backup_script_logs 
WHERE event_source = 'backup_db' AND message = 'Finished database backup.'

SELECT
  CASE
    WHEN message = 'Existing backup with recent modify time found, exiting.' THEN 'Skipped'
    WHEN message = 'Database backup is disabled.' THEN 'Disabled'
    WHEN message = 'No internet connection available.' THEN 'No internet'
    WHEN message = 'Internet connection is metered, exiting.' THEN 'Metered connection'
    WHEN message = 'Production server is currently unreachable.' THEN 'Server unreachable'
    WHEN message LIKE '%Database backup execution finished with a non-zero exit code%' THEN 'Error'
    WHEN message = 'Finished database backup.' THEN 'Success'
	WHEN message IS NULL THEN 'No data'
    ELSE 'Unknown'
  END as status
FROM (
  SELECT
    message
  FROM backup_script_logs
  WHERE event_source = 'backup_db'
  AND record_time IN (
    SELECT
      MAX(record_time) as record_time
    FROM backup_script_logs 
    WHERE event_source = 'backup_db'
  )
  UNION ALL -- add a second line no data case
  SELECT NULL as message
) msg
LIMIT 1

SELECT
  (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - COALESCE(MAX(record_time), TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01')
  )))::INTEGER / 60 AS "Time Since Database Backup"
FROM backup_script_logs 
WHERE event_source = 'backup_static_files' AND message = 'Finished static files backup.'

SELECT
  CASE
    -- WHEN message = 'Existing backup with recent modify time found, exiting.' THEN 'Skipped'
    WHEN message = 'Static files backup is disabled.' THEN 'Disabled'
    WHEN message = 'No internet connection available.' THEN 'No internet'
    WHEN message = 'Internet connection is metered, exiting.' THEN 'Metered connection'
    WHEN message = 'Production server is currently unreachable.' THEN 'Server unreachable'
    WHEN message LIKE '%Static files backup execution finished with a non-zero exit code%' THEN 'Error'
    WHEN message = 'Finished static files backup.' THEN 'Success'
	  WHEN message IS NULL THEN 'No data'
    ELSE 'Unknown'
  END as status
FROM (
  SELECT
    message
  FROM backup_script_logs
  WHERE event_source = 'backup_static_files'
  AND record_time IN (
    SELECT
      MAX(record_time) as record_time
    FROM backup_script_logs 
    WHERE event_source = 'backup_static_files'
  )
  UNION ALL -- add a second line no data case
  SELECT NULL as message
) msg
LIMIT 1

SELECT
	AVG(login_count) AS "Avg Daily Logins",
	MAX(login_count) AS "Max Daily Logins"

FROM (
	SELECT
		calendar_dates.d AS date,
		COALESCE(login_count, 0) AS login_count
	FROM (
		SELECT 
			record_time::DATE AS login_date,
			COUNT(DISTINCT server_auth_logs.record_id) AS login_count
		FROM server_auth_logs

		LEFT JOIN known_ips		-- known_ips keeps unique pairs of login_date + remote
		ON server_auth_logs.remote = known_ips.remote
		AND login_date - known_ips.login_date BETWEEN -7 AND 7

		WHERE
			record_time >= '${__from:date}' AND record_time <= '${__to:date}'
			AND known_ips.remote IS NULL

		GROUP BY record_time::DATE

		ORDER BY login_date
	) login_count_by_date		-- Get daily count of logins from unknown ips

	RIGHT JOIN (
		SELECT calendar_dates::date AS d
		FROM GENERATE_SERIES(
		'${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
		'${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
		'1 day'::INTERVAL
		) calendar_dates
	) calendar_dates	-- Generate all dates for query period and join dailt login counts to them
	ON calendar_dates.d = login_count_by_date.login_date

) calendar_login_dates

SELECT
	AVG(COALESCE(failed_logins_count, 0)) AS "Avg Daily Failed Logins",
	AVG(COALESCE(bans_count, 0)) AS "Avg Daily Bans",
	MAX(failed_logins_count) AS "Max Daily Failed Logins",
	MAX(bans_count) AS "Max Daily Bans"
FROM (
	SELECT
		event_date,
		SUM(CASE WHEN event_type = 'Found' THEN event_count ELSE 0 END) AS failed_logins_count,
		SUM(CASE WHEN event_type = 'Ban' THEN event_count ELSE 0 END) AS bans_count
	FROM (
		SELECT
			record_time::DATE AS event_date,
			event_type,
			COUNT(*) AS event_count
		FROM fail2ban_logs
		WHERE record_time >= '${__from:date}' AND record_time <= '${__to:date}'
		GROUP BY 
			record_time::DATE,
			event_type
	) daily_events_count_multiline

	GROUP BY event_date
) daily_events_count

RIGHT JOIN (
	SELECT calendar_dates::date AS d
	FROM GENERATE_SERIES(
	'${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
	'${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
	'1 day'::INTERVAL
	) calendar_dates
) calendar_dates	-- Generate all dates for query period and join dailt login counts to them
ON calendar_dates.d = daily_events_count.event_date

SELECT
	AVG(COALESCE(number_of_failed_logins, 0)) AS "Avg Daily Failed Logins",
	MAX(number_of_failed_logins) AS "Max Daily Failed Logins"
FROM (
	SELECT
		record_time::DATE AS record_date,
		COUNT(*) AS number_of_failed_logins
	FROM app_access_logs
	WHERE
		record_time >= '${__from:date}' AND record_time <= '${__to:date}'
		-- record_time BETWEEN '2023-01-08' AND '2023-02-11'
		AND path = '/auth/login'
		AND status = 401
	GROUP BY record_time::DATE
) failed_logins_by_date
RIGHT JOIN (
	SELECT calendar_dates::date AS d
	FROM GENERATE_SERIES(
	'${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
	'${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'::DATE,
	-- '2023-01-08',
	-- '2023-02-11',
	'1 day'::INTERVAL
	) calendar_dates
) calendar_dates	-- Generate all dates for query period and join dailt login counts to them
ON calendar_dates.d = failed_logins_by_date.record_date

panels.description: Total number of requests processed by site backend with 500+ response code over the period

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  -- record_time::DATE as "Date",
  COUNT(*) AS "Number of Errors"
FROM app_access_logs
WHERE
  record_time >= '${__from:date}' AND record_time <= '${__to:date}'
  AND status >= 500
-- GROUP BY record_time::DATE

panels.title: Backend Errors

panels.description: Number of scheduled database jobs, which failed during their last execution

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
	SUM(
		CASE
			WHEN number_of_error_lines > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0
  		END
	) AS "Number of Failed Scheduled Jobs"
FROM (
	SELECT
		job_type,
		SUM(
			CASE
				WHEN level = 'ERROR' THEN 1 ELSE 0
	   		END
		) AS number_of_error_lines
	FROM (
		SELECT
			database_scheduled_jobs_logs.job_type AS job_type,
			database_scheduled_jobs_logs.level AS level
		FROM database_scheduled_jobs_logs
		INNER JOIN (
			SELECT
				job_type,
				MAX(record_time) AS record_time
			FROM database_scheduled_jobs_logs
			WHERE
				record_time >= '${__from:date}' AND record_time <= '${__to:date}'
				-- record_time BETWEEN '2023-01-13' AND '2023-02-12'
			GROUP BY job_type
		) as max_timestamps
		ON database_scheduled_jobs_logs.record_time = max_timestamps.record_time
		AND database_scheduled_jobs_logs.job_type = max_timestamps.job_type
	) last_records_per_job_type
	GROUP BY job_type
) error_lines_per_job_type

panels.title: Failed DB Jobs
